This includes custom-built drones and drones built from a kit or off-the shelf. Drones under 250 g do not need to be registered unless something is attached to it that increases its weight to 250 g or more. Marking your drone You must clearly mark your drone with its registration number. You can use: permanent marker permanent label engraving Penalties If you fly a drone without meeting these requirements, you may be fined. Fines are: $5,000 for recreational users $25,000 for commercial users Benefits of registration If you lose your drone, registration may help in returning it to you if it is found If there is a recall from the manufacturer, we may be able to notify you How to register your drone Individuals and businesses can register their drone through the Drone Management Portal . Registering your drone as a foreign pilot Foreign pilots or operators can’t register drones. You need an SFOC-RPAS to comply with the Canadian Aviation Regulations (CARs). What you need before you start It should take 3 minutes to register a drone. To begin, you will need the following information: purchase date (if applicable) make, model, serial number and type of drone a Visa®, Mastercard®, or American Express® credit card, Apple Pay® or Google Pay® Debit cards may be used if added to your Apple Wallet® app, or Google Pay® app How to Mark Your Drone (PDF 443 Kb) Text description Know before you go!
